document_title: Autoimmune hepatitis: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Signs of autoimmune hepatitis are different for each person and each stage. Most patients discover that they have hepatitis when the disease has entered an advanced stage.
1. Initiation phase
Symptoms of autoimmune hepatitis range from mild to severe. In the early stages, the patient may not feel any health changes.
2. Progressive stage
When the liver begins to become more seriously damaged, symptoms will gradually appear (there are also cases of sudden appearance) - the most common is fatigue and drowsiness. Accompanied by symptoms such as: (4)
Stomach feels uncomfortable; Inflammation or skin irritation, itchy skin, jaundice; Yellow whites of eyes; Joint and bone pain; Or nausea or vomiting; Darker urine, pale stools; Anorexia; Weight loss without reason; Body weakness; Get diarrhea; Irregular or amenorrhea; Abdominal swelling, fluid accumulation, liver pain (also called ascites); Brain and liver problems (drowsiness, poor concentration, loss of consciousness, etc.)
Abdominal pain and discomfort are one of the warning signs of autoimmune hepatitis
